title: What are the inventions that haven't been invented yet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Isaac Newton said it best: “I do not know what I may appear to the world, but to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore, and diverting myself in now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.” A bit overstated, especially these days, where we have learned an enormous amount about how the world works and how to adapt that knowledge into useful technology, but still makes a good point. We know a lot, but there are things we don’t even know we don’t know. Think of science as a body of knowledge expanding irregularly into the universe of the unknown, some gulfs of ignorance still remaining, some voids of ignorance remaining even within the main body. We can really only identify things that “haven’t been figured out yet” that are within sight of what we know. So we can name things like cures for cancers, complete cures or preventions for many infectious diseases, meaningful extension of healthy human lifespans, reliable genetic engineering, cyborg implants better than the original, easy space travel, easy interstellar travel, unified theories of physics, room temperature superconductors (including whether they are actually possible). The list is enormous. I would not, however, include “how people can live in peace” like another respondent mentioned. We already know how to do do that: just respect each other’s individual rights to live by their own judgement, free from the initiation of physical force. Though we haven’t yet figured out how to persuade the entire world of that simple principle!

Electronic mood “pacemakers’ that keep people out of depression.Mind/ machine interface that allows people to store memories in the Cloud.Tiny translators that translate for you in almost real time.Electronic rodent traps that attract and electrocute rodents and seal the carcass in an air-tight package.Pedestrian/ bike transponders that communicate to automobiles within 200 ft that make sure that the autos know they are there and their exact position even in heavy fog or smoke.Giant robots that will fight forest fires.Bio-welding that will re-attach severed nerves and allow them to grow back together.
